metadata.name: Auth Learnings
metadata.description: Authentication and OAuth related learnings and fixes

learning.title: OAuth Configuration Mismatch for Local Development
learning.problem: OAuth returns errors when running locally: - invalid_client: Unauthorized - mismatching_state: CSRF Warning! State not equal in request and response
learning.root_cause: Multiple configuration issues: 1. Environment detection incorrectly uses staging OAuth for local development 2. OAuth credentials not properly loaded from environment variables 3. Session middleware configuration incompatible with local development 4. Redirect URI mismatch between configured and actual URLs

solution.step: Update environment detection to properly handle local development
Support multiple OAuth credential naming conventions
Configure session middleware for local development
Add localhost:3010 to allowed redirect URIs

learning.prevention: Always test OAuth flow locally before deploying to staging. Use environment-specific configuration files (.env.local.staging). Run OAuth diagnostic script: python scripts/fix_oauth_local.py

learning.title: OAuth Environment Variable Configuration
learning.problem: OAuth credentials not loading from environment variables
learning.root_cause: Multiple naming conventions for OAuth credentials: - GOOGLE_CLIENT_ID vs GOOGLE_OAUTH_CLIENT_ID_DEV - Environment variables not loaded before checking

solution.step: Support both naming conventions in environment_config.py

learning.prevention: Standardize environment variable naming across environments. Document required environment variables in .env.example.

learning.title: Session Middleware Configuration for OAuth
learning.problem: OAuth state parameter validation fails due to session issues
learning.root_cause: Session middleware configured with https_only=true for local development. Same-site cookie policy incompatible with OAuth flow.

solution.step: Configure session middleware based on environment
Add DISABLE_HTTPS_ONLY option for local testing

learning.prevention: Test OAuth flow with different cookie configurations. Document session requirements for OAuth in each environment.

learning.title: OAuth Redirect URI Configuration
learning.root_cause: Redirect URIs in Google Cloud Console don't match application configuration. Different ports used for local development (3000, 3010, 8000).

solution.step: Add all local development URLs to Google Cloud Console OAuth app
Update environment_config.py to include all redirect URIs
Log redirect URI being used for debugging

learning.prevention: Maintain list of authorized redirect URIs in documentation. Log OAuth configuration during initialization. Check redirect URIs match between code and Google Cloud Console.

learning.title: OAuth Diagnostic Tool Creation
learning.problem: Difficult to diagnose OAuth configuration issues
learning.solution: Created diagnostic script: scripts/fix_oauth_local.py - Checks environment variables - Validates OAuth configuration - Suggests specific fixes - Loads .env file automatically
learning.usage: Run: python scripts/fix_oauth_local.py Checks all OAuth-related configuration and suggests fixes.

learning.title: OAuth Staging Errors on Localhost (January 2025)
learning.problem: When running locally with staging configuration: - invalid_client: Unauthorized (wrong OAuth credentials) - mismatching_state: CSRF Warning (session not maintaining state)
learning.root_cause: Critical configuration mismatches: 1. Environment detection was simplified and removed localhost checks 2. Staging OAuth credentials used with localhost redirect URIs 3. Session middleware not properly configured for localhost 4. OAuth state parameter lost due to cookie configuration

solution.step: Enhanced environment detection to force development OAuth for localhost
Added localhost detection based on multiple indicators
Fixed session middleware to use lax same-site for localhost
Added validation to ensure redirect URI matches allowed list

code_changes.change: Added localhost detection logic to _detect_environment() Forces development OAuth unless FORCE_STAGING_OAUTH=true
Fixed session middleware to detect localhost properly Sets same_site="lax" and https_only=False for localhost
Added OAuth credential validation Enhanced redirect URI validation Better error handling with specific messages

learning.prevention: ALWAYS force development OAuth for localhost URLs. Test OAuth flow locally before deploying. Run: python scripts/setup_oauth_local.py to configure. Check Google Console redirect URIs match exactly.

learning.title: OAuth Configuration Environment Hierarchy
learning.insight: OAuth must use environment-appropriate credentials: - Localhost MUST use development credentials - Staging deployments use staging credentials - Production uses production credentials

rules.rule: Never use staging/production OAuth with localhost URLs
Always validate redirect URI is in allowed list
Session cookies need same_site="lax" for localhost

learning.environment_detection: Priority order for detecting localhost: 1. FRONTEND_URL contains localhost 2. API_URL contains localhost 3. PORT is 8000, 3000, or 3010 4. Not running in Cloud Run (no K_SERVICE) 5. FORCE_LOCAL_OAUTH=true

learning.title: OAuth Setup Automation
learning.solution: Created comprehensive setup scripts: - setup_oauth_local.py: Configure for localhost - fix_oauth_local.py: Diagnose issues
learning.usage:
# Setup OAuth for local development python scripts/setup_oauth_local.py
# Diagnose OAuth issues python scripts/fix_oauth_local.py
learning.features: - Detects existing configuration - Validates Google Console setup - Creates .env.local with proper settings - Runs diagnostic checks - Provides clear next steps

learning.problem: Authentication logic was potentially duplicated across multiple files in the system. This created maintenance burden and risk of inconsistent auth behavior.
learning.root_cause: Previous directory name "dependencies_auth" did not clearly communicate that this was the MANDATORY shared auth service for the entire system.
learning.solution: 1. Renamed app/dependencies_auth/ to app/auth_integration/ for clarity 2. Updated all imports throughout the system 3. Created SPEC/shared_auth_integration.xml documenting MANDATORY use 4. Added clear documentation that ALL auth MUST use this service
learning.prevention: - Directory name "auth_integration" clearly indicates integration point - Documentation emphasizes MANDATORY use throughout system - No duplicate auth logic allowed anywhere - Single source of truth for all authentication
learning.key_functions: - get_current_user(): For protected routes (returns user or 401) - get_current_user_optional(): For optional auth (returns user or None) - validate_token(): For WebSocket authentication
learning.impact: - Consistent auth behavior across entire system - Single point for security updates - Easier testing with single mock point - Reduced code duplication - Simplified compliance and auditing
